description: One dozen of 36 cinnamon products tested by a consumer group contained elevated levels of lead, according to a study released on Thursday that reinforced concerns about metals in foods after tainted cinnamon applesauce poisoned dozens of children last year.

title: Israeli Commandos Carried Out Raid on Secret Weapons Site in Syria
description: Israel carried out a commando raid in Syria on Sunday that obliterated a Hezbollah missile production facility near the Lebanese border, killing a number of people at the site, according to American and other Western officials.

title: Something Important Is Happening With JD Vance, Laura Loomer, Project 2025 and Donald Trump
description: Right-wing absurdities — Donald Trump’s comments about Haitian migrants eating pets, JD Vance’s comments about “childless cat ladies” (among other things), Project 2025’s ideas, the conspiracist Laura Loomer being in Trump’s inner circle — are breaking through to regular Americans and undecided voters to a degree that undermines the Trump campaign’s goal of positioning the former president as the more moderate, change-oriented candidate in the race. To me, this is the biggest political dynamic coming out of Tuesday’s debate.

title: Satellite TV Is in Trouble. DirecTV’s Dispute With Disney Shows Why.
description: It’s no secret that the TV business is in upheaval. And in the sea of struggling companies, satellite TV distributors may be in the most precarious position.

title: 7 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: Two of our recommended titles this week explore surprising connections between humans and other members of the animal kingdom. In “Raiders, Rulers, and Traders,” David Chaffetz makes a thorough case that horses were the deciding factor enabling the spread of empires across ancient Asia, and in “Rat City” Jon Adams and Edmund Ramsden revisit a groundbreaking academic study that shed light on the ways people resemble rats and vice versa.

title: Francine Leaves Behind Flooding and Power Outages in Louisiana
description: The storm made landfall as a Category 2 hurricane on Wednesday before weakening overnight into a tropical depression.

title: Mark Jury, Whose Stark Photography Captured the Vietnam War, Dies at 80
description: Mark Jury, a photographer whose searing, intimate images from the battlefields of South Vietnam and the deathbed of his coal miner grandfather filled the pages of two critically acclaimed books in the 1970s, died on Aug. 27 in Scranton, Pa. He was 80.

title: Ex-C.I.A. Officer Who Spied for China Is Sentenced to 10 Years in Prison
description: A former C.I.A. officer and contract translator for the F.B.I. who accepted thousands of dollars in cash and expensive gifts, such as a new set of golf clubs, in return for providing classified information to the Chinese government was sentenced on Wednesday to 10 years in prison, prosecutors said.

title: Taylor Swift’s Call to Vote Sent Hundreds of Thousands to Registration Tools
description: Taylor Swift’s endorsement of Vice President Kamala Harris on Tuesday and her call for her fans to vote drove hundreds of thousands of people to voter registration resources.

title: Is Inequality the Key to the Climate Change Debate?
description: Climate change wasn’t a big topic in the debate between Vice President Kamala Harris and Donald Trump on Tuesday night. Trump all but ignored the ABC News moderators when they asked what he would do about climate change, and Harris mostly talked about it in economic terms, talking up the Biden administration’s investments in clean energy and the new jobs they created.

title: Will Taylor Swift’s Endorsement Actually Affect the Election?
description: To some Americans, the biggest news to come out of the presidential debate Tuesday night was not Kamala Harris’s well-received performance. It was Taylor Swift’s endorsement of her minutes after the debate ended.

title: How Media on the Left and Right Covered Taylor Swift’s Harris Endorsement
description: After Taylor Swift endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris on Tuesday night, media outlets broke from their coverage of the presidential debate and dedicated ample coverage to the megastar.

title: In Fight for Congress, Democrats Run as ‘Team Normal,’ Casting G.O.P. as ‘Weird’
description: Representative Greg Landsman’s pitch to the voters of his politically competitive district in Ohio goes something like this: You may once have preferred Republicans, but the leaders of today’s G.O.P. have gotten, well, too weird.

title: Why Your Favorite Restaurant Sounds Like That
description: Simon Kim knows exactly how many beats per minute are in each song played in his restaurants.

title: 3 Red Cross Workers Killed in Ukraine by Shelling
description: Three Red Cross workers were killed and two wounded on Thursday when artillery fire struck a frontline aid distribution site in Ukraine on Thursday, the organization said.

title: Their School Has Yet to Reopen After a Shooting. They’re Unsure What to Expect.
description: Before “lockdown” flashed on classroom screens last Wednesday and Apalachee High School changed irrevocably, its 1,900 students were getting into the groove of a new academic year.

title: What’s Going On in This Picture? | Sept. 16, 2024
description: 1. After looking closely at the image above (or at the full-size image), think about these three questions:

title: North Dakota’s Abortion Ban Is Overturned
description: A North Dakota judge overturned the state’s near-total abortion ban on Thursday, saying that the State Constitution protected a woman’s right to abortion until the fetus was viable.

title: This Chatbot Pulls People Away From Conspiracy Theories
description: Shortly after generative artificial intelligence hit the mainstream, researchers warned that chatbots would create a dire problem: As disinformation became easier to create, conspiracy theories would spread rampantly.

title: What Students Are Saying About Summer Vacation and Heading Back to School
description: Our weekly Current Events Conversation is back. Every Thursday during the school year, we round up a selection of student comments from one or more of our daily writing prompts. We welcome voices from teenagers from anywhere in the world. We hope you’ll join us this school year!

title: Bob Weatherwax, Trainer of Lassie and Other Celebrity Dogs, Dies at 83
description: Bob Weatherwax, a Hollywood dog trainer who carried on his father’s legacy of breeding and coaching collies to play Lassie, the resourceful and heroic canine who crossed flooded rivers, faced down bears and leaped into the hearts of countless children, died on Aug. 15 in Scranton, Pa. He was 83.

title: United States Backs Africa’s U.N. Security Council Bid, With a Catch
description: The United States would support two permanent seats for African states on the U.N. Security Council, Linda Thomas-Greenfield, the American ambassador to the United Nations, said on Thursday. But the path to making that promise a reality is complicated.

title: ‘The Smoking Room’ Is a Brilliant British Office Comedy
description: The two-season comedy “The Smoking Room” (on the Roku Channel) premiered in Britain in 2004, and in some ways it can feel even older: A designated indoor cigarette-smoking lounge at an office? Nary a phone in sight, and only glancing mentions of the internet? Next you’re going to tell me they’re rendering tallow and writing out the Bible by hand.

title: Harvard, Brown and Other Top Schools Are Thinking About Black Freshmen the Wrong Way
description: Several highly selective universities have recently reported that in their first freshman classes admitted after the Supreme Court banned racial preferences in admissions, the number of Black and Latino students has fallen.

title: As Venezuela Slides Deeper Into Autocracy, U.S. Imposes Limited Sanctions
description: The United States announced on Thursday it was imposing sanctions on 16 Venezuelan government officials appointed by the country’s autocratic president, Nicolás Maduro, in response to the disputed presidential election on July 28.

title: What’s Going On in This Graph? | Summer Olympics Medal Count
description: Update, Sept. 18: An earlier version of this graph did not include the “Possible rank in Olympic medal count” key. We have added that key above the graph.

title: La Grenouille, Vestige of New York’s Old-School French Dining, Will Close
description: La Grenouille, the last survivor of an elegant corps of French restaurants that arrived in New York in the 1960s and helped secure the city’s reputation for sophisticated dining, will close this week. Its current owner and operator, Philippe Masson, “is moving on to explore new terrain and pursue other dreams,” according to a notice posted Wednesday on the restaurant’s Instagram account.

title: Climate Lawsuits Are Exploding. Are Homicide Charges Next?
description: Lawsuits against fossil fuel companies over climate change are piling up. Legislators and activists are pushing prosecutors to pursue criminal charges. Children are suing governments, arguing that their right to a healthy environment is being trampled on.

title: $47 Million Flowed Into Harris Campaign in 24 Hours After Debate
description: Vice President Kamala Harris raised $47 million in the first 24 hours following her debate with former President Donald J. Trump on Tuesday night, a sum that will likely expand a widening funding gap between the two campaigns.

title: Fall’s Best Boots Are Rugged and Buckled
description: These are about as classic as it comes, and exceptionally sturdy — they’re made from full-grain leather (the most durable part of a hide) with an oil-resistant outsole — which is no surprise, considering Durango has been making cowboy boots since the 1960s.

title: Déjà Vu for Mike Johnson as Internal Strife Stalls Spending Plan
description: With a funding deadline looming, the Republican House speaker was caught between his far right and others in his party eager to avoid a confrontation with Democrats that could shutter the government and cost them politically.

title: Report Concludes China Broke Rules in Doping Case but Clears WADA
description: The World Anti-Doping Agency’s executive board on Thursday eagerly embraced a report that validated its decision to clear 23 elite Chinese swimmers of doping, even as the report’s author pointed out Chinese officials had violated established rules in their handling of the incident.

title: The Bars With the Best Free Food
description: Need I say more? I suppose I will, mainly for the sake of hitting my required word count. In, sorry, this economy, free stuff is the ultimate treat. Especially at a bar or restaurant, as the prices of food and drinks continue to rise and rise, seemingly with no ceiling. Even something small, like a bowl of cheese balls at a dive bar (ahem, the Levee) is a touch that makes you feel like a V.I.P., no matter where (or who) you are.

title: 18,000 Miles Later, an American Woman Has Cycled the World
description: Lael Wilcox hopped on her bicycle in Chicago in May. Three and a half months later, she was back, having ridden 18,000 miles around the world and set what is being hailed as a new women’s record.

title: A Famous Churchill Portrait, Stolen in Canada and Found in Italy
description: For three decades, a fierce-looking Winston Churchill, a hand on his hip, stared down guests in a lounge at the Fairmont Château Laurier hotel in Ottawa.

title: Trump Says He Won’t Debate Harris Again
description: Former President Donald J. Trump insisted on Thursday that there “will be no” second debate against Vice President Kamala Harris, two days after a face-off in which he was widely criticized for delivering a poor performance filled with missed opportunities.

title: Scenes From Southern California as Wildfires Persist
description: Longtime residents in the mountain region of Southern California have seen decades of wildfires ravage their neighborhoods, counting themselves lucky when their homes and loved ones have survived. But over the last week, a triple threat of large fires has torn through Los Angeles and neighboring counties, burning longstanding and newly built homes, displacing thousands, and torching more than 100,000 acres of land.

title: Sybil Haydel Morial, New Orleans Civil Rights Matriarch, Dies at 91
description: Sybil Haydel Morial, an activist who was also the matriarch of the most prominent civil rights family in New Orleans, died on Sept. 3 in that city. She was 91.

title: A New Mini-Moon Is Being Captured by Planet Earth
description: When approaching Earth, asteroids tend to do one of two things: Most of the time, they miss. Sometimes, they hit, leaving a bright streak in our planet’s sky or a gruesome new wound in its crust. But very rarely, an asteroid is captured by Earth’s gravity and pirouettes around the planet, becoming, in effect, a moon — albeit an ephemeral one.

title: Early Voting Is Beginning in These States. Here’s What to Know.
description: Election Day is still about two months away, but many voters have options to cast their ballots before Nov. 5. Some have already started receiving mail-in ballots.

title: Biden Poised to Approve Ukraine’s Use of Long-Range Western Weapons in Russia
description: President Biden appears on the verge of clearing the way for Ukraine to launch long-range Western weapons deep inside Russian territory, as long as it doesn’t use arms provided by the United States, European officials say.

title: Tracking Post-Tropical Cyclone Ileana
description: See the likely path for Ileana.

title: Here’s Why Trump Was Forced to Say He Has Only ‘Concepts of a Plan’
description: Kamala Harris exceeded my expectations in her debate with Donald Trump on Tuesday. I knew that she was smart, but for whatever reason, many insiders have questioned her political talent. I assume that her remarkable skill at baiting Trump into one trap after another has ended those questions.

title: Justice Dept. Charges Two Men in Jan. 6 Assault on Times Photographer
description: The Justice Department on Thursday charged two men with assaulting a New York Times photographer on Jan. 6, 2021, accusing them of pushing her to the ground and stealing her camera as they participated in the storming of the Capitol.

title: Friday Briefing: U.S. May Let Ukraine Use Long-range Weapons
description: President Biden appeared on the verge of approving Ukraine’s use of long-range Western weapons on targets deep inside Russian territory on the condition that it doesn’t use arms provided by the U.S., according to European officials.

title: The National Park Service Is More Than Just Its Iconic Hat
description: The runways of fashion month have had people talking about the boldest designs at New York Fashion Week and beyond, but the National Park Service has been keeping it far more simple — yet arguably just as iconic — by posting videos to Instagram of park rangers from across the country showing off their uniforms with the hashtag #npsfashionweek.

title: Justice Dept. Official Calls Election Meddling a ‘Clear and Present Danger’
description: The Justice Department’s top national security official warned on Thursday that foreign interference in the 2024 election posed a “clear and present danger” and said that Russia was ramping up its disinformation efforts in hopes of helping former President Donald J. Trump.

title: The N.Y.P.D. Commissioner Resigned
description: Edward Caban, the New York City police commissioner, announced today that he had resigned. Officials in City Hall had asked Caban to quit after federal agents seized his phone last week as part of a criminal investigation — one of several focused on members of Mayor Eric Adams’s administration.

title: Attorney General Warns Against Politicizing the Justice Department
description: Attorney General Merrick B. Garland warned on Thursday against allowing the Justice Department to be politicized, saying “there is not one rule for friends and another for foes.”

title: Harris Courts Polish American Votes in Pennsylvania
description: Polish Americans are not an ethnic group that typically gets mentioned in modern American presidential debates.

title: The Long List of Moderators Trump Has Called Unfair After Tough Debates
description: As former President Donald J. Trump sought to minimize the damage done by Tuesday night’s debate, selling his defensive, angry and frequently fact-challenged performance as a resounding victory over Vice President Kamala Harris, he resorted to a time-tested tactic.

title: A Soprano Who Despises Encores Interrupts Her Co-Star’s
description: It was the third act of Puccini’s “Tosca” at a theater in Seoul, and the South Korean tenor Alfred Kim, responding to enthusiastic applause, was singing a rare encore of “E lucevan le stelle,” one of the opera’s most beloved arias.

title: ‘The Killer’s Game’ Review: Catch Him if You Can
description: “The Killer’s Game” begins with an atypical boy-meets-girl scenario. The high-end assassin Joe Flood, played by the bullet-headed Dave Bautista, spies his future love, the modern dancer Maize (Sofia Boutella), as he interrupts one of her performances in an ornate hall in Budapest. The interruption is a violent one: He shoots one of the spectators, and while Joe has the discretion to use a silencer, his prey’s bodyguards get a little loud. In the ensuing melee, Joe winds up in possession of Maize’s cellphone.

title: U.N. and Britain Denounce Israeli Attack in Gaza That Killed U.N. Workers
description: Condemnation mounted on Thursday of a deadly Israeli strike on a school turned shelter in central Gaza, but Israel said that the compound, crowded with people driven from their homes, had become a command center for militant fighters.

title: Georgia Judge Tosses 3 More Charges in Trump Election Interference Case
description: A judge in Atlanta threw out three charges in the Georgia election interference case against Donald J. Trump and his allies on Thursday, saying the state did not have jurisdiction to bring them.

title: Sean Combs’s Legal Team Takes His Case to TikTok
description: The typical playbook for a defense lawyer representing a celebrity facing damaging accusations often features a sharply worded denial, promises to eventually reveal all at trial, and perhaps a strategically placed tabloid pushback story.

title: New York City to Consider Reparations for Descendants of Enslaved People
description: Almost 200 years after slavery officially ended in New York, the City Council passed legislation on Thursday authorizing a commission to study the devastating effects of human bondage and to develop a plan to make reparations for the harms caused.

title: Joe Schmidt, 92, Dies; Made Middle Linebacker a ‘Defensive Quarterback’
description: Joe Schmidt, the Detroit Lions Hall of Famer who played a pioneering role in the emergence of pro football’s glamorous middle linebacker spot while starring on two league championship teams in the 1950s, died on Wednesday in Palm Beach Gardens, Fla. He was 92.

title: ‘Why Am I So Single?’ Review: After ‘Six,’ a Scrappy, Sappy Dating Musical
description: In London’s West End, two lonely singles are feeling sorry for themselves. Nancy (Leesa Tulley) and her gay, nonbinary best friend, Oliver (Jo Foster), conduct a two-hour inquest into their romantic failures while quaffing cheap bubbly on a peach-colored couch. At the same time, they bat around an idea for a musical based on these travails, which — you guessed it — turns out to be the musical we’re watching.

title: Harris Challenges Trump to Debate Again as She Rallies in North Carolina
description: At her first post-debate campaign events, Vice President Kamala Harris repeatedly challenged former President Donald J. Trump to a second onstage clash and sought to use her opponent’s erratic performance as a springboard into the race’s final stretch.

title: New Hampshire Tightens Requirements for Voters
description: Gov. Chris Sununu of New Hampshire signed a bill on Thursday that creates a strict photo identification requirement to vote, allowing for no exceptions. The bill would also require first-time voters to present proof of citizenship when registering to vote.

title: Screamin’ Scott Simon, Dynamic Sha Na Na Keyboardist, Dies at 75
description: Screamin’ Scott Simon, who as the dynamic keyboardist for the rock ’n’ roll revival act Sha Na Na paid homage to Jerry Lee Lewis with electrifying versions of “Great Balls of Fire” and “Whole Lotta Shakin’ Goin’ On,” and who played a vital role as the band’s managing partner, died on Sept. 5 in Ojai, Calif. He was 75.

title: 10-Minute Challenge: ‘The Unicorn Rests in a Garden’
description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.

title: ‘Big Weather Break’ Gives California Firefighters the Upper Hand
description: After days of fire behavior that officials described as extreme and erratic, Southern California firefighters on Thursday said they were able to gain ground on major wildfires as weather conditions shifted in their favor.

title: How a Cultural Shift Favors Harris
description: American culture changes with astonishing speed. Nearly every decade, there are shifts in values, fashions and norms — in the whole atmosphere of national life. Sometimes when you’re watching a presidential campaign, it is best to ask: What year is it? What values and moods are dominant in America right now? Which candidate just seems right for this moment, and which candidate is simply out of step with the zeitgeist?

title: ‘Uglies’ Review: Beauty Is a Beast
description: “Uglies,” based on the young adult book series by Scott Westerfeld, presents a cheekily vapid solution to world peace: At age 16, everyone is surgically enhanced to be pretty, thus eradicating inequality and conflict.

title: Antisemitic Ads About Doug Emhoff Target Muslim Voters in Michigan
description: The tone of the ad is celebratory.

title: The First Votes Will Soon Be Cast
description: When Krissi Miles, the manager of absentee voting in Tuscaloosa County, Ala., began electronically issuing ballots to military service members yesterday, she was taking a routine step that’s part of a milestone for this election.

title: Mexico Remakes Its Entire Judicial System as States Back Vast Overhaul
description: Mexico’s states swiftly moved to remake the country’s entire judicial system on Thursday, approving an amendment to the Constitution that would be the most far-reaching judicial overhaul ever attempted by a large democracy.

title: What to Know About New York City’s Interim Police Commissioner
description: Thomas Donlon, a Bronx native who has an extensive background in federal law enforcement, will become New York City’s interim police commissioner following the resignation of Edward A. Caban on Thursday.

title: Will Electing Judges Make Mexico’s Courts Better, or More Political?
description: A landmark shift unfolded in Mexico on Thursday as a majority of its 32 states approved an overhaul of the country’s judicial system. In a monumental change, thousands of judges would be elected instead of appointed, from local courtrooms to the Supreme Court.

title: Border Agents Made Decision to Confront Gunman in Uvalde, Report Finds
description: Amid two years of painful wrangling over the delayed police response to the deadly shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, the role of the federal agents who finally breached the classrooms and killed the gunman has largely avoided scrutiny.

title: Trump Defends Debate Performance and Calls for Ending Tax on Overtime
description: Although it had been billed as an event focused on housing and the economy, former President Donald J. Trump spent much of a meandering speech on Thursday in Tucson, Ariz., venting his grievances over his debate against Vice President Kamala Harris.

title: Correction Officers Who Failed to Aid Dying Inmate Won’t Be Charged
description: Michael Nieves sliced his throat with a razor around 11:40 a.m. on Aug. 25, 2022. For the next 10 minutes, correction workers at the Rikers Island jail complex stood by his cell and watched him bleed without providing medical care.

title: Review: Patti LuPone and Mia Farrow Clean Up in ‘The Roommate’
description: “Expansion is progress,” Sharon says sweetly, parroting a phrase from a business journal for the benefit of her new roommate, Robyn.

title: Laura Loomer, a Social-Media Instigator, Is Back at Trump’s Side
description: Follow along with live updates on the Trump and Harris campaigns.

description: Jump to: Tricky Clues

title: ‘Counting and Cracking’ Review: One Family’s Tale Fit for an Epic
description: Some shows use an extended running time to challenge the audience and its perceptions. Pulling viewers into a trance state and testing their endurance is the ultimate artistic gambit.

title: California Man Assaulted Frontier Flight Attendants, Prosecutors Say
description: A California man accused of assaulting crew members and threatening to kill everyone aboard a Frontier Airlines flight was arrested Wednesday on federal charges, prosecutors announced.

title: Chad McQueen, ‘Karate Kid’ Actor, Dies at 63
description: Chad McQueen, an actor who was best known for the role of Dutch in the “Karate Kid” movie franchise and who was the son of the actor Steve McQueen, died on Wednesday at his home in Palm Desert, Calif. He was 63.

title: Quote of the Day: Will Taylor Swift’s Endorsement Actually Affect the Election?
description: “Young voters don’t trust a lot of institutions, they don’t trust a lot of traditional leaders, they do trust the people that they idolize.”

title: Corrections: Sept. 13, 2024
description: An article on Wednesday about cholera outbreaks around the world misstated the projected production of cholera vaccines by EuBiologics, a South Korean pharmaceutical company in 2025. EuBiologics is unlikely to be able to produce more than 70 million doses of the vaccine, not 50 million.

title: Former High School Classmates Finally Become Sweethearts
description: Austin J Mills said he remembered Taylor Beverly Mills, then Taylor Dordick, as “the popular older girl with the quarterback boyfriend” when they were both students at Beverly Hills High School in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2010.

title: After a Slow Start, Smooth Skating
description: Sarah Casey Botwinick and Jason Gabriel Pollack were undergraduates at Lehigh University at the same time, though they didn’t meet until post-college, in February 2020, on the dating app Hinge. At first, “it was slow going,” Mr. Pollack said. “It took her a week to answer my messages. I would answer immediately.”

title: Friends for 16 Years. Lovers for One Night.
description: “Do you think we would have fought if we’d been a couple?” my best friend Jeff asked me the day before he died.

title: South Meets North India at an Inclusive Hindu Wedding
description: Dr. Yuvaram Nellore Vilambi Reddy and Chetan Bhasker Jhaveri exchanged pride garlands — six roses in subtle rainbow colors alternating with traditional red and white ones — on Aug. 10 in the grand ballroom at the Springfield Country Club in Springfield, Pa.

title: After a Life of Competitive Sports, Love Is Now Their Priority
description: A fan of Greek mythology might say that Zeus had a hand in the future of Nicholas Scarvelis, a Greek American Olympian shot putter. It was a future where he simultaneously stepped away from his first love of competing professionally to a new kind of love when he connected with Noelle Zappia on a dating app in October 2019.

title: Pakistan Seemed Close to Beating Polio. Now It’s Spreading Quickly.
description: For a brief moment two years ago, Pakistan seemed finally on the verge of defeating polio. One of only two countries in the world where the virus remains endemic, Pakistan recorded no new infections for a little over a year starting in 2021 — the longest virus-free stretch the country had ever experienced.

title: Pope’s Grueling Asia Tour Points Toward a Less-Western Church
description: Over the last couple of weeks, Pope Francis hoisted himself up on sore legs dozens of times. As he crisscrossed large swaths of the Asia Pacific region, he shuffled from cars to his wheelchair, from the wheelchair to makeshift papal thrones and on and off many planes as hot, tropical winds blew on the tarmac.

title: Friday Briefing
description: President Biden appeared on the verge of approving Ukraine’s use of long-range Western weapons on targets deep inside Russian territory on the condition that it doesn’t use arms provided by the U.S., according to European officials. Biden is expected to discuss the issue today when he meets with Britain’s new prime minister, Keir Starmer, in Washington.

title: Barely Escaping: Video Captures a Woman Staggering Through a California Wildfire
description: Like an apparition, a woman appears out of an inferno, flames swirling, her hair and dress whipped in searing wind, bright embers skidding along the roadway under her feet. For a moment, it seems impossible that she will survive.

title: Boeing’s Strike Halts Airplane Production at Key Plants
description: Thousands of Boeing workers went on strike on Friday after overwhelmingly rejecting a contract their union negotiated, a potentially costly disruption to the aerospace giant as it tries to recover from a series of safety crises.

title: The U.S. Military Is Not Ready for the New Era of Warfare
description: The First Matabele War, fought between 1893 and 1894, foretold the future.

title: A Long Life, Thanks to Where You Live? Not Likely, Says Ig Nobel Winner.
description: Five years ago, Saul Newman published what he thought was groundbreaking research about “blue zones” — places like Okinawa in Japan and Sardinia in Italy, where many people reputedly lead astonishingly lengthy and healthy lives. These areas have long inspired envy, curiosity and dietary fads. And many scientists have tried to understand how some people can live well past 100 in good health.

title: North Korea Gives First Glimpse of Weapons-Grade Uranium Factory
description: North Korea on Friday revealed a weapons-grade uranium-manufacturing site for the first time, as its leader, Kim Jong-un, flaunted his expanding nuclear weapons program ahead of the United States presidential election in November.

title: Word of the Day: circumvent
